DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Prior Malignant Neoplasm Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether treatment of a previous or different tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells, that invade other tissues by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Prior Malignant Neoplasm Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the treatment of a previous tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells, that invade other tissues by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation having been administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Given.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior radiation therapy for c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiation therapy for current study cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior Radiation Therapy for other malignancy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiotherapy to the breast or prior radiation to the region of the ipsilateral breast that would result in overlap of radiation therapy fields

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiotherapy to the head or neck (except for T1 glottic cancer), resulting in overlap of radiation fields

ReferenceDocuments.name: GI_CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiotherapy to the region of the liver that would result in overlap of radiation therapy fields

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy to a field that included or had scatter to the liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF  Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient previously received systemic, radiation, or other treatment for uterine cancer?
